definition: to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: The sea in the sails, call your motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召喚你揚帆遠航，高山在激勵你奮力攀登。

sentences.english: Even as We sail and sail, We are a still picture.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我們啓航，揚帆遠航，我們是一個靜止圖像。

sentences.english: Have tough-minded boy only, ability appeases billows, hoist the sails Yuan Hang.
sentences.chinese: 只有意志堅強的小夥子，才能平息波瀾，揚帆遠航。

sentences.english: Globalization has not turned out to be the rising tide that lifts all boats.
sentences.chinese: 全球化沒有成爲使所有船隻揚帆遠航的東風。

sentences.english: The sea is calling you sail, motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召喚你揚帆遠航，高山在激勵你奮力攀登。

sentences.english: For my purpose holds to sail beyond the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 爲了理想我揚帆遠航去超越落日。

sentences.english: Life in fierce dynamic, at any time by the sails of cup be puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 生活處於激烈變動之中，隨時受揚帆遠航的盅惑。
